title: Early Voting wins Preakness Stakes
description: Early Voting, trained by Chad C. Brown and ridden by Jose L. Ortiz, has won the 147th Preakness Stakes on Saturday at Pimlico Race Course in Baltimore.

title: One dead after finishing Brooklyn Half Marathon and 15 others injured
description: • Justin Thomas wins 2022 PGA Championship after dramatic three-hole playoff

title: Tiger Woods withdraws from PGA Championship after posting in career-worst round at the event
New York court releases new congressional map after Democratic-drawn lines were blocked
description: New York Judge Patrick McAllister approved the court-appointed special master's new congressional map for the state late Friday night.

title: Kylian Mbappé rejects Real Madrid move to stay at Paris Saint-Germain
description: French superstar Kylian Mbappé has decided to stay at Paris Saint-Germain rather than join Real Madrid, ending one of football's biggest transfer sagas.

title: Biden's North Korea strategy is a major shift from Trump's showman diplomacy
description: • US and South Korea signal willingness to expand military drills in response to north

title: 2-year-old orders 31 cheeseburgers after mom leaves phone unlocked
description: A Texas mother learned an important lesson about leaving her phone unlocked after her 2-year-old son accidentally ordered 31 McDonald's cheeseburgers from DoorDash.

title: Lyon stuns holders Barcelona to win eighth Champions League title
description: Lyon stunned Champions League holders Barcelona 3-1 to win a record-extending eighth title.

title: Allegations that Minneapolis police spied on Black organizations can't be substantiated, prosecutor says
description: Explosive allegations that Minneapolis police used covert social media accounts to spy on Black organizations and elected officials can't be substantiated by prosecutors, the deputy city attorney said in a letter Friday.

title: Woman storms Cannes red carpet denouncing sexual violence in Ukraine
description: A topless protester with blue and yellow paint across her chest and stomach ran onto the red carpet at the Cannes Film Festival on Friday protesting sexual violence in Ukraine, video taken at the festival shows.

title: Palestinian teen shot and killed in exchange of fire with Israeli military in Jenin
description: A 17-year-old Palestinian was killed and an 18-year-old was critically injured by Israeli fire during an Israeli military raid in Jenin in the West Bank Saturday, the Palestinian Ministry of Health said.

title: Joy Division frontman Ian Curtis had 'two personas.' Bandmates rue failure to prevent singer's suicide
description: It has been 42 years since Ian Curtis, the lead singer of the legendary post-punk rock band Joy Division, took his own life.

title: Tiny tooth fills in gaps in the human family tree
description: Have you ever wondered whether, tens of thousands of years from now, you could end up in the fossil record? I confess I have.

title: People still call restaurants. Applebee's is hiring someone else to answer
description: Believe it or not, people still order takeout using the phone. Applebee's doesn't want to take those calls anymore.

title: Boris Johnson is living in a slow-motion disaster movie
description: Boris Johnson has been able to end what might have otherwise been a troubling week with an unexpected sigh of relief.

title: 'Love on the Spectrum' comes to the US — and it's the uplifting dating show you need right now
description: Love, a blockbuster and a heartwarming win.

title: A 17-year-old died by suicide hours after being scammed. The FBI says it's part of an increase in 'sextortion' cases
description: Ryan Last received a message on a school night in February from someone he believed to be a girl.

title: Where things stand after nearly three months of war
description: It is nearly three months since Russia invaded Ukraine -- a 12-week period in which Russian forces have wrought devastation on the country and its people, resulting in death on a vast scale and causing millions to flee.

title: Analyzing body language in Depp vs. Heard
description: Veteran body language expert Janine Driver says Johnny Depp is hugging his attorney in the courtroom "to get Amber's goat," that Heard's crying is "bad, bad acting," and that the "case is nuttier than a Snickers bar."

title: Can social media ban 'Replacement Theory'?
description: Several mass shooters have attributed their actions to the "Great Replacement Theory."  Some want social media to ban the topic altogether. Is that desirable - or even possible?

title: 'I'm exhausted. It's suffocating': Black Americans tell CNN they are just tired of the same story
description: CNN asks Black viewers how they feel about navigating daily life after the most recent racially motivated mass shooting.

title: An author who studies diverse democracies shares what he sees as the future of the US
description: An army of commentators have rightly condemned a belief called "replacement theory," which a young White man cited before killing 10 people, most of them Black, Saturday at a supermarket in Buffalo, New York.

title: HealthyBaby CEO weighs in on baby formula shortage and why it never should have happened
description: CNN International anchor Zain Asher interviews HealthyBaby founder and CEO Shazi Visram about the US baby formula shortage.

title: Some of our stereotypes about glasses may have basis in fact
description: Admit it: If you see someone wearing glasses, you think that person has a better chance than not of having an above-average IQ.

title: 15-year-old suspect arrested in the shooting death of an 11-year-old girl in the Bronx
description: A 15-year-old was arrested Friday in connection with the fatal shooting of an 11-year-old girl in New York City's Bronx neighborhood earlier this week, police said.

title: Simona Halep: 'He brought that fire back': How Patrick Mouratoglou helped former world No. 1 rekindle her love for tennis
description: This time last year, Simona Halep was on the brink of retirement.

title: A guide to more sustainable flying
description: As pandemic-related restrictions start to lift, and we emerge from the lockdown shadows, one thing is returning to the minds and spending of many people: travel.

title: Travelers are out for 'revenge' after being at home for two years. Here's what they're splurging on
description: This week in travel: an upside-down train, the meaning of "revenge travel" and the world's greatest fried foods.

title: 550-pound alligator goes for a dip in family's swimming pool
description: A behemoth alligator in Florida enjoyed an early start to the summer -- by jumping into a family's swimming pool.

title: Are Japanese toddlers as independent as Netflix's Old Enough portrays them?
description: Ramen chef Kantaro Ishii has fond memories of working at his father's izakaya near their home in the city of Sendai, Japan.

title: One dead, more than 40 injured as Michigan tornado causes 'catastrophic' damage
description: A tornado quickly moved through the town of Gaylord in the northern Lower Peninsula of Michigan Friday afternoon, leaving one person dead and 43 injured, officials said.

title: North Korea expected to be central part of Biden's meetings with South Korea
Giuliani meets with January 6 committee for more than 9 hours
description: Rudy Giuliani, former President Donald Trump's onetime personal attorney and a lead architect of his attempt to overturn the 2020 election results, on Friday met with the House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, insurrection, two sources told CNN.

title: English FA to review regulations following recent incidents of 'anti-social' behavior from fans
description: The Football Association (FA) said it will work with English football clubs to address recent incidents of fans entering the pitch, vowing to review its regulations to put a stop to unruly fan behavior.

title: On frontlines with Ukrainian forces after Russian attack near Kharkiv
description: • US intel skeptical Putin will be swayed by Russian public opinion

title: CDC monitors 6 people in US for possible rare monkeypox, says public 'should not be concerned'
description: Officials at the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention are closely tracking recent clusters of monkeypox infections around the world -- and possible cases in the United States.
